main event: Multiple sightings of an unidentified flying object reported in the New Mexico-Texas area on April 16, 1960.
interesting points: Lt. Dinny observed a stationary object for about 5 minutes before it departed at high speed., Capt. Mason saw a descending object that later climbed rapidly., There were multiple confirmed reports from different locations, including Amarillo and Clovis., The object was described as having an elongated shape with colored lights, resembling a fireball., Investigations suggested it could be a meteor or a satellite reentry.
sighted object: single, brilliant-white light and elongated shape with colored lights
witness description: Lt. Dinny from the 149th Observation Squadron, Captain Mason from Clovis, NM, and additional reporting military personnel.
